column2: OREGON PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Oregon
column6: OR

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Warning signs (diamond)
column6: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
column8: Railroad advance warning signs (round)
column10: None of the above.

column2: 2. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
column6: the road ahead is narrow.
column8: the right lane ends.
column10: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way

column2: 3. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column6: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column10: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.

column2: 4. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column6: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column8: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.
column10: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.

column2: 5. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column6: Double curve ahead.
column8: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 6. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 7. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It improves the steering ability.
column6: It improves the vehicle stability.
column8: It helps increase your stopping distance.
column10: It's an automobile safety system.

column2: 8. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: wait for the next green light.
column6: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 9. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column8: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column10: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.

column2: 10. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
column4: Braking distance.
column6: Reaction distance.
column8: Perception time.
column10: Steering ability.

column2: 11. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column4: number of cars in front of you.
column6: number of cars behind you.
column8: presence of a yield sign.
column10: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: Flagger ahead
column6: Crossroads ahead
column8: Turn right or go through
column10: Side Road

column2: 13. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column6: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column8: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column10: pass the car on the left.

column2: 14. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 15. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.
column6: indicate no pass zones.
column8: typically provide guidance to drivers.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 16. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
column4: changes in traffic lanes.
column6: drowsy driving.
column8: curves ahead.
column10: road construction.

column2: 17. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column6: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column10: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway ends ahead.
column6: Reversible lane ahead.
column8: Divided highway ahead.
column10: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Winding Road Ahead
column6: No turns are allowed on this road
column8: Right lane closed
column10: Do Not Enter

column2: 20. When you approach a railroad crossing, but you do not see a train. You must stop:
column4: if a crossing gate is lowered.
column6: if the crossing lights are flashing.
column8: if a stop sign is posted.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 21. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column4: Warning signs
column6: Destination signs (guide signs)
column8: Service signs
column10: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 22. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: drive in the right lane only.
column6: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column8: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column10: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.

column2: 23. This sign indicates:
column4: A no-passing zone
column6: A shared lane
column8: A slow-moving vehicle
column10: Yield

column2: 24. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must always come to a complete stop.
column6: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column8: must cross the intersection immdiately.
column10: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.

column2: 25. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column6: race on empty roads.
column8: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column10: share the lane with another vehicle.

column2: 26. This sign warns that:
column4: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.
column6: traffic must merge left.
column8: traffic must merge right.
column10: the pavement ends.

column2: 27. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column6: they must not make a right turn.
column8: U-turns are not allowed.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 28. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column6: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column8: The bus is about to stop.
column10: You must pass the school bus.

column2: 29. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column6: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column8: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column10: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.

column2: 30. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column6: look toward the right side of the road.
column8: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column10: look toward the left side of the road.

column2: 31. This sign means:
column4: Shopping centre ahead.
column6: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column8: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column10: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.

column2: 32. Always maintain a safe following distance from the vehicle in front of you. A safe following distance is defined as:
column4: 5-10 seconds.
column6: One second.
column8: 4-6 seconds.
column10: 2-4 seconds.

column2: 33. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column6: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column8: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column10: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.

column2: 34. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: when feeling angry or upset.
column6: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column8: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column10: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.

column2: 35. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Only if the light is green.
column6: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column8: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column10: Yes.
